list.name: Changes
list.comment:
ACTUALLY got the keys to work this time
Adjusted the names of the scales to be accurate, but only sometimes :(
Added some extra API endpoints
Added the rest of the modes into the scales page and rendered them in a FlatList

task.summary: Default task
testing copy push
- Changed the large Add To Routine button to the smaller one on the scales page to make room for a View Details button
- Got navigation between the main page and details page working - Got dynamic image rendering to work - Fixed styling issues in the scale container
- Created layout for scale details page - Random notes options are working
Added Root Note selector to Scales Details page Added structure to Home page
Did a tiny bit of work on the home and routine building page, started trying to work with my APIs
Fixed the app from not working randomly, thanks kc npx expo start s
APIS ARE WORKING!!! \o/
Scale Details Updated: - Key selector works - Note selection in custom options works - Placeholder no longer needs to be deleted in the time per note selection field
Created stuff for the routines
Made some modifications regarding routines, including getting their creation on the builder page to work
Adjusted the ScaleNote model to WORK
Added routine description and began working on the routine block component for the home page

Fixed the routines API call
Fixed an issue with loading the scale notes in the details page
Fixed an issue where only the first scale's notes would be displayed upon visiting other scale details page
Added routines blocks to home page
Adjusted the navbar to only render the desired items

Added the ScaleExerciseRoutine (ugly ahh name) entity to the DBContext
Created an endpoint to get the scale exercises from the routine id

Created some API endpoints for SERoutines, Scale Exercises, and Routines
Found some issues with the navigation, still need to fix navigating to ScaleDetails, as the params do not pass correctly

Removed the unnecessary Data.tsx file Updated the ScaleExercise class to extend Exercise as to make selecting exercises in Training.tsx easier Updated the Routine class to store exercises as an array. This is then updated in AddToRoutineModal.tsx Got selection of items working in AddToRoutineModal.tsx Fixed navigation to RoutineDetails.tsx

Moved GetScaleExercisesByRoutineId and GetRoutinesByScaleExerciseId to ScaleExerciseController.cs and RoutineController.cs respectively
Updated SERoutine on the server side to handle duplicate entries, removing the need to check for it on the client side Updated SERoutine to make Routine and ScaleExercise optional navigation properties, allowing the create endpoint to be called properly
Added exercise as a property to be passed into the modal, allowing it to set the exerciseId and scaleExerciseId to their proper numbers

Got creation of SERoutines to work
Got annoyed by API errors being thrown on the scales detail page, so I removed the AddToRoutine button from the page
Got the routine exercises to be updated and passed into the training page
Updated exercise to directly input the scale options instead of having an object inside
Updated RoutineDetails.tsx to display information regarding the exercises as well as labeling the existing items

Fixed the getScaleById API Endpoint
Added a list of exercises included in a routine to the RoutineDetails page

Removed the default index header
Began developing progress bar Thanks https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J95MC2Koymc

Removed the default index header
Began developing progress bar Thanks https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J95MC2Koymc
Developed a countdown timer
Began introducing audio to the program

Fixed my screw-up from last night where I did another EF Core Reverse Engineer and it removed like all of my models
Fixed an error where going into the scales page and adding a scale to a routine would not update said routine when navigating back to the home page
Fixed a bug where,after selecting routines, re-opening the Add To Routine Modal would keep said routines selected.
GOT AUDIO TO WORK! Albeit crunchy as hell
Modified the .wav to .mp3 in the Sound model, considering dropping the FilePath column and passing in (`${note.noteName}${sound.octave}`) to the selectSound function or removing the file extension from the FilePath records

Automated the playing of sounds in order
Adjusted the octaves to increment after C is passed
Implemented ascending & descending scale listening mode
Made the timer activate only after all sounds have been played from a given exercise
Implemented guessing functionality, allowing the user to go to the next exercise after viewing their results from the previous guess
Made the timer freeze after guessing and reset back to the original duration after going to the next exercise

Fixed a bug where the timer would only reset back to the original duration once
Changed the way the checkGuess function worked so that the program doesn't have to check the type of the exercise passed in, as this is already being performed in getNextExercise(). Instead, I created a new state variable, correctAnswer, and set this inside of getNextExercise().
Updated the UI to hide the Submit button after the timer has run out
Updated the UI to have better feedback than "Yippee!" and ":(". This includes displaying the correct answer to the user in the event that they get the answer wrong.
Updated the UI to display the amount of CORRECT guesses out of the total exercises played as opposed to the current number of exercises played

ACTUALLY got the keys to work this time
Adjusted the names of the scales to be accurate
Added some extra API endpoints

ACTUALLY got the keys to work this time
Adjusted the names of the scales to be accurate, but only sometimes :(
Added some extra API endpoints
Added the rest of the modes into the scales page and rendered them in a FlatList
